The Doomcloak gains 8 vigor, then moves into an adjacent foe’s space, sharing it, with the following effects:

subcontent.content: While in this stance, both this beast and its chosen foe are immobile.
The choked foe takes [D]+fray damage at the start of their turn, ignoring vigor, and cannot gain vigor while being smothered.
When the Doomcloak takes damage, the choked foe take 2 piercing damage. This effect can trigger any number of times.
When the Doomcloak’s vigor is broken or replaced, this stance ends, removing it, and placing it into an adjacent space.
When damaged by an ability from an adjacent foe.
The kelpie can force that foe to make a save or adhere to its hide.

description.content: While adhered, the foe cannot move or be placed more than 1 space from the kelpie, and when the kelpie moves or teleports, they are removed from the battlefield, then placed adjacent to the kelpie when it stops moving.
They can save to repeat this effect at the end of their turn. A kelpie can only adhere to one character at once, and can choose which to keep or lose.

subcontent.content: Deal 3 damage to all other foes adjacent to the Kelpie.
Deals bonus damage to characters inside its deep water zones or characters adhered to the kelpie.

description.content: Then deals 2 damage to adjacent foes and shoves them 1.
The Chimaera rushes 1, then deals 2 damage to an all adjacent foes.
The Kelpie spurts fetid water, blinding a foe in range.
Blinded foes, or foes inside its deep water zone, take 3 damage.
A character inside one of the Kelpe’s deep water zones is teleported to any space inside one of its other zones.
Foes can pass a save to avoid this effect, but are dazed on a successful save.
The Kelpie disperses into seaweed and water and reappears in any space inside one of its deep water zones, teleporting.
At the start of the round, the Hellhound creates two terrain effect spaces in free spaces in range 6.
The area is dangerous terrain, and all damage against characters other than the hound at least partly in the space becomes piercing.
All characters take 2 piercing damage and are shoved 1.
Corrosive gas clouds can also be moved 1 space towards or away from the Hellhound, which could cause them to enter characters’ spaces.
At the end of that character’s next turn, if that character is still marked, the Hellhound shoots a fiery blast for a medium blast explosion area effect.

Characters within must save. On a successful save, they take fray damage. On a failed save they take [D]+fray. If the explosion would include one or more spaces of corrosive gas, it detonates the area, destroying it but dealing fray damage to all characters in the area per space detonated. Then, this effect ends.
At the start of the round, the Fisher puts a lure out adjacent to a foe of its choice.

At the start of the round, either the Gigantapede’s head or tail becomes immune to all damage until the end of the round. The Gigantapede can choose which starts immune, but the effect must swap back and forth.

subcontent.content: Foe must save or be stunned. Can be made from the head or tail.

description.content: All foes adjacent to the Gigantapede take 2 damage.
A character adjacent to the Gigantapede’s tail is marked.
While marked, they are slashed+, and shoved 2 in a direction of the Gigantapede’s choice at the start of their turn.
A character can end this mark if they end their turn without moving.
All characters adjacent to the Gigantapede’s head are shoved 1, then remove it from the battlefield.
It’s head then resurfaces in a new space in range 5, returning it to the battlefield. Place its body in any configuration.
Characters inside must save or take 3 damage, damage 3 times, or just once on a successful save.

subcontent.content: Can only be made from the head.
This attack can only be made from the Lure’s location instead of the Kingfisher’s main body.
Foe must save or be stunned.
Deals bonus damage to weakened foes.

description.content: The fisher moves its lure up to 4 spaces towards it, then shoves all adjacent characters to the lure the same amount in the same direction.
Characters can pass a save to reduce this shove to 1.
Foes take 3 damage and must save or be weakened.
The Kinfisher submerges into the ground, removing itself from the battlefield, then resurfaces in free space in range 4, even to an occupied area.
When it resurfaces, characters in its area take fray damage, are removed then placed in the closest adjacent space of its choice, then shoved 1.

subcontent.content: Create a toxic pool difficult terrain effect space under the attack target.
Foes that end their turn in this space gain 1 petrification.
Inflict 1 petrification on the attack target.

description.content: A foe in range, takes 2 damage, is dazed, and infected with a petrifying poison.
At the end of their next turn, they take 1 petrification unless they end that turn adjacent to one or more allies. Then, this effect ends. This effect does not stack.
The Basilisk spits up a height 1 object, a pillar of toxic bile, in range.
Foes that end their turn adjacent to one or more of these pillars gain 1 petrification per pillar.
Adjacent characters take fray damage, are shoved 1 and become slashed.

subcontent.content: Affects foes in range 2, and slashed foes must save or be stunned.
Affects all foes, everywhere, and ignores cover.
The Chimaera can rush 2 spaces before making this attack.

description.content: The Bull rushes 1. Each time it rushes, it deals 2 damage to all adjacent foes and shoves them 1.

subcontent.content: Foe is pacified. This attack does not break the pacified condition and deals bonus damage to pacified foes.

description.content: The Serpent creates a small blast terrain effect in range. The area is dangerous terrain for foes and foes are pacified+ inside.
While at least partly inside the area, the Serpent attacks and saves with +1 boon. This area lasts until used again.

subcontent.content: The Serpent can have up to three of these areas active.
The character gains an open wound. While wounded, it takes [D] again at the end of its turns. This effect does not stack, and ends instead if the character ends their turn adjacent to an ally.

description.content: The Crocodile chooses a foe in range. At the end of the very next player turn, if that foe is still in range 3, the Chimaera lunges.

It can remove itself from the battlefield, then place itself adjacent to that foe, who must save. Foes are dazed and take 2[D] + fray on a failed save, or just fray damage on a successful save. Dazed foes fail the save.

subcontent.content: The target is shoved 2 towards the chimaera.

description.content: A adjacent character must save or be swallowed whole. On a successful save, they are weakened. Remove them from the battlefield.
At the start of their turn, the toad spits them out, placing them in any adjacent space to the chimaera’s current location, then shoving them 2 spaces.

subcontent.content: Character also takes damage on being spit out equal to 25% of their maximum hp.

description.content: Adjacent foes to the Chimera are shoved 1 towards or away from it.

subcontent.content: Deals bonus damage for every object caught in the area.
Attack target must save or be stunned.
Does not need to combo with Deep Breath.

description.content: Characters in the area takes 2 piercing damage.
Summon a height 1 smoldering debris object in the area.

subcontent.content: Deals bonus damage to blinded foes.
May dash 2 after using this ability.

description.content: Fray damage and foes must save or become blinded.

subcontent.content: Deals fray damage twice instead. Bloodied foes take fray damage three times instead.

description.content: While the goat is alive, at the start of the round, mark a visible space.

At the end of the round, a meteor smashes into the space, inflicting fray damage twice in a large blast area effect centered on the space to all foes within and stunning any foe in the center space. Then, create a height 1 comet object anywhere in the area.

subcontent.content: Shove all foes in the area 1.

description.content: All characters not in cover from the Chimaera must save or take fray damage twice and become vulnerable, or once on a successful save.
Then, summon a height 1 meteor object adjacent to any character affected.

subcontent.content: Fray damage three times on a failed save.
Fray damage five times on a failed save.

description.content: A character in range becomes pacified and starts to be encased in a stone egg. If they don’t attack during their turn, the petrification effect ends. Otherwise, at the end of that turn, they must save.

On a failed save, they are encased in stone, removing them from the battlefield and becoming replaced with a destructible (5 hp) height 1 egg object. Until the is destroyed, they cannot take a turn. When it’s destroyed, they are returned to the battlefield in the space they left and can take a turn as normal.

subcontent.content: Deals bonus damage per status affecting the target.

description.content: A character in range 8 is slashed. Unless that character moves at least 3 spaces on their next turn, at the end of that turn they are also stunned.

subcontent.content: Also deals fray damage to a chosen character, and fray damage again if they fail to move.

description.content: At the start of the round, all foes take piercing damage equal to the round number +1, ignoring cover. This damage cannot reduce a foe below 1 hp.
The Apex rushes 3, then deals 2 damage to adjacent foes and shoves them 1. If it starts this movement inside a Hunting Ground, it can rush 5 or fly 3 instead.
The Apex slams the ground in a medium blast area effect in range. Foes inside take fray damage, then it rears up. At the end of the very next turn, it lands, shoving all foes inside 3.
The Apex shove all adjacent foes 1, then gains 10 vigor. Its next attack deals bonus damage, and gains pierce. However, after it attacks, the Apex loses any vigor it has.

An adjacent character must save. On a successful save, they take fray damage and are shoved 2 in any direction. On a failed save, the Apex picks them up in jaws or paws, removing them from the battlefield.
At the start of that character’s next turn, the Apex tosses them, placing them back on the battlefield in a free adjacent space to the Apex, then shoving them 2.

subcontent.content: Foe and all adjacent foes to its target are slashed. Slashed foes take fray damage again.
Apex may dash up to 4 before making this attack.
Create a pit under the attack target. Characters already in pits are stunned.
Apex may dash 1 either before or after this attack.

description.content: The Wyrm chooses a foe at the start of the round. At the end of the round, after all other effects have resolved, all foes not in range 2 of that foe take 5 divine damage, ignoring cover.

At the end of every round, as a path of ruin effect, the Wyrm marks out an area that extends from the entire path of ruin edge up to 4 spaces from that edge. The Wyrm can not voluntarily enter this area.
At the end of the round, it scours the area as a massive area effect. Foes inside must save or take 2[D]+fray damage and be stunned, or [D]+fray on a successful save.
At the start of every odd numbered round, the Wyrm creates a twisting, burning tornado, a one space mobile terrain effect, in range 3. The Sirocco is difficult and dangerous terrain.

At the end of the round, as a path of ruin effect, all Siroccos move 3 spaces towards the path of ruin. After each space of this move, they shove all adjacent foes 1 space away from them. Then, any foes shoved by at least one Sirocco during this movement are inflicted with Dragonfire. Siroccos last indefinitely.
At the start of the round, the Wyrm liquifies the ground beneath a foe’s feet. That foe takes 2 piercing damage and becomes immobile.

If the affected character would be inflicted with dragon fire, the rock melts and is destroyed instead of dragon fire’s normal effects. The immobilized character or an adjacent character can also chip the rock off by using the interact ability (1 action) and ending their turn. When the rock is destroyed, this effect ends.

The Wyrm chooses a foe in range 3 that has not acted yet. At the end of that foe’s turn, the Wyrm fires a massive beam as a path of ruin effect. If that foe ends their turn within range 3 of the Wyrm, they are inflicted with dragonfire. If not, then the beam sweeps across the entire battlefield and hits all foes, inflicting dragonfire on all of them.
As a path of ruin effect, all foes must choose:

subcontent.content: Be shoved 1 towards the path of ruin.

description.content: The Wyrm creates a height 2 blight pillar object in free space in range 3. The pillar and all spaces in a small blast area centered on it are dangerous terrain, which the wyrm is immune to. When it is created, adjacent foes take 2 piercing damage.
The Wyrm rushes 2, then an adjacent foe must choose: stand their ground or flee.

subcontent.content: Become slashed and take fray damage. Then save, or also be inflicted with dragonfire on a failed save.
Be shoved 4 spaces. The Wyrm can choose the direction of this shove, and can change directions mid-shove..

description.content: The Wyrm chooses a foe in range that has not acted yet. At the end of that foe’s turn, a geyser erupts under them, dealing fray damage and inflicting weakened as a medium blast area effect centered on them. Weakened foes take [D] +fray instead.

subcontent.content: The Wyrm may rush 1 before this attack

The Wyrm soars into the air. It removes itself from the battlefield, then as a path of ruin effect draws a line area effect 3 spaces wide straight across the battlefield, starting on the side opposite the path of ruin edge, and ending with the path of ruin edge. Foes inside take piercing fray damage. Then the Wyrm returns to the battlefield in range 2 of its original location.

description.content: The Tomb Guard gains aura 1 until the start of its next turn.
While this aura is active, the Tomb Guard gains counter, and allies without this ability in the aura gain resistance.

subcontent.content: The Servitor may rush 1 before using this ability.
Characters take 2 damage. Any character at the very end of the line is weakened.

description.content: Swap places with an adjacent ally, removing and placing both characters.

subcontent.content: Has no maximum range and ignores cover against slashed foes.

description.content: Repeat the following effect three times:

subcontent.content: Either the Legionary or an adjacent ally rushes 1, then deals 2 damage to all adjacent foes and shoves them 1. This can affect the same foe more than once.
in a free space in range, then deals 1 piercing damage to all foes adjacent to that summon.

description.content: The Grafter gains aura 1 in this stance.
Each time a relict in the aura takes damage from an ability, they gain 2 vigor. This effect could trigger multiple times per ability. After that ability resolves, the Grafter sacrifices 2.
At the start of its turn, the Grafter either exits this stance or sacrifices 4 to maintain it.
Foes take 2 piercing damage. Self and allies gain vigor 2.

subcontent.content: The Embalmer gains Aura 2 until the start of its next turn. Foes that end their turn in the aura must sacrifice 2 and have a grasping dead space created under them, as per Black Communion.

description.content: A foe in range must sacrifice 2, once for every one of its adjacent allies, then is pacified.
Mark a foe in range. While marked, that foe gains Aura 2.
Foes that end their turn in the aura must sacrifice 2. A foe can save to end this mark if they end their turn with no allies in the aura.
Target defeated relict in range and remove incapacitated.
They stop being defeated and return to the battlefield with 50% hp, or 25% hp if they are an elite. They can act normally and take a turn starting next round.
If defeated again, they disintegrate and are removed from the battlefield, and cannot be returned again.
The relict entombs a character in range in a magical sarcophagus, summoning it in their space.
If a character is defeated in the sarcophagus, it crumbles and this effect ends.
All adjacent foes must save or be forced to flee, shoving them 3 spaces in a direction of the Wailer’s choice, or 1 space on a successful save.
The Ghul and any adjacent relict teleport 6. When they reappear, they must be placed adjacent if possible.

subcontent.content: The Twinsoul may backflip and fly 2 after this ability resolves.

description.content: The Ghul gains aura 2 until the start of its next turn.
Foes that end their turn in the aura must sacrifice 25% of their max hp and become dazed. Dazed or blinded foes must sacrifice 50% of their max hp instead.

subcontent.content: The Stutterghast or an ally in range 2 teleports 2.
Deals bonus damage to bloodied foes.
Gains unerring against foes at exactly range 3.
May teleport self and foe 2 spaces after this ability resolves.

description.content: Creates a massive network storm in range, which could overlap characters. The storm is a small blast terrain effect that is dangerous terrain, which relict ignore.
Foes in the storm are vulnerable+.
Using this ability again with an active storm can move the storm 2 spaces instead of replacing it. If used this way, it costs 1 action.

subcontent.content: Moving a storm is a free action.

description.content: The Wraith chooses two characters anywhere in range 3 of each other, then teleports one of them adjacent to the other.
Foes must save or be shattered. Becomes a free action if it targets two allied relict.
Teleport to the space of any pit in range.
Create a pit under any character in range.
Then, the Wraith may teleport that character to any other pit space in range 3 of their target’s location.

subcontent.content: Foes in the area must save or be shattered.
All objects in the path are removed.
The coffin breaks open. The Blasphemy becomes intangible until the end of its next turn.
Deals bonus damage to characters at 50% hp or lower.
Instead of dealing damage, character targeted sacrifices hp equal to the damage that would have been dealt. If a character is at 1 hp, they are instead instantly defeated.
Deals bonus damage to pacified foes and does not break the pacified condition.

description.content: While marked, that foe deals half damage unless adjacent to an ally.
If they end their turn adjacent to an ally, they can save to clear this mark.
The Silent one gains aura 1 until the start of its next turn.
Characters in the aura are pacified+ and cannot be cured.
The Silent one moves into and shares the space of an adjacent character, possessing them, with the following effects:

subcontent.content: While possessing that character, they are intangible, share its space, and move when it moves. They can still take actions normally, but can’t leave the possessed character’s space.
The possessed character takes a free action at the end of its turn, which the Silent One chooses:
Be shoved by the Silent one 3 spaces in any direction
Deal [D] damage to an adjacent character.
A character may save to remove this effect at the end of their turns after the above effect activates. When possession ends, the silent one appears in a free adjacent space.
May dash 2 before and after this action.

description.content: Deal fray damage. If a foe has vigor, deal [D] instead, and they are dazed.
The Strigoi gains stealth. Choose a foe in range 3.
If, at the end of that foe’s next turn, they are still in range 3 of the Strigoi, it may teleport adjacent to them and deal 2 damage, three times, ending this effect and stealth.
The Automata creates a 1 space terrain effect in range 3.
Relict inside the terrain effect have cover, and it is dangerous and difficult terrain for foes.
Using this ability again replaces it.
The Automata shoots a line 5 area effect. Characters in the area take 1 piercing damage twice.
If the area includes a Charged shield, deals 1 piercing damage four times instead.

subcontent.content: Deals bonus damage to weakened foes.
Fused may rush 2 after this ability. Characters inside the fused are shoved 3 in any direction.

description.content: The Fused releases a horrible shriek in a medium blast area effect.
Foes in the area are weakened, and take 2 damage once for every foe in the area, up to a maximum of five times.
All foes are shoved 1 and take 2 damage.
All adjacent foes are shoved 1 and slashed.
Slashed foes also take fray damage.
The Idol hardens and release an aura of swirling souls, gaining aura 2 until the start of its next turn. It becomes immobile and unstoppable.
Relict in the aura become sturdy and gain resistance to damage from abilities used from outside the aura.

subcontent.content: Hit or miss, foe must also sacrifice 25% of their max hp.

description.content: The Life Hunter flies 1. Before they fly, they may shove an adjacent character 1 space, then deal 2 damage to them if they are a foe. If they do, they fly 3 instead.
Mark a foe in line of sight and range 10.
At the end of that character’s turn, it takes [D] piercing damage if it’s not in cover from the Life Hunter, or just 2 piercing damage if it is. Then this mark ends.

subcontent.content: Bloodied or dazed foes take 2 damage again after this ability resolves.

description.content: An adjacent foe sacrifices 3. If they are bloodied, they sacrifice 6 instead, and the Revenant gains evasion until the start of its next turn.
Foes in the aura gain +1 curse on attacks. Allied Relict in the aura gain the dodge trait.
The Revenant loses this stance if it ends its turn with no foes in the aura.
The Revenant releases a bone chilling scream, a burst 1 area effect.
Characters in the area must save or take 2[D] +fray, or [D]+fray on a successful save.

subcontent.content: Deals damage again to attack target and all foes adjacent to the attack target, hit or miss, equal to 2 times the round number

description.content: Either the Immortal or an adjacent ally rushes 1, then deals 2 damage to all adjacent foes and shoves them 1. This can affect the same foe more than once.
The Immortal rushes after the target, following it, ending adjacent if possible.

subcontent.content: Foe is also slashed and takes fray damage.

description.content: All allies everywhere may rush 1 space closer to this character. Bloodied allies gain 2 vigor.
A foe in range at 25% HP or lower must save. On a failed save, they are defeated, ignoring all other effects. On a successful save, they are reduced to 1 hp.
All characters in range 2 of the royal guard are shoved 1 towards or away from it.

subcontent.content: The Royal Guard marks their attack target. This mark can be placed more than once and stacks indefinitely.

For each stack of the mark, this attack deals +3 damage on hit or miss. A character can save against this mark at the end of their turn to clear all stacks, but only if they are not in range 2 of the royal guard.

description.content: An ally in range is marked by the Royal Guard. While marked and adjacent to the Royal Guard, they gain +1 boon on saves and resistance.
Fray damage and characters must save or be slashed.

The Royal Guard rushes 1, then deals [D] to all adjacent characters, then shoves them 1. It gains phasing during this action and must take each of these dashes in the same direction. Characters can be affected multiple times.
At the start of each round, the Warmech fires a plasma bomb into the air, targeted on any visible space. The bomb marks a medium blast area visible to all characters.
At the end of the round, the bomb comes down as an area effect. Characters in the area take piercing fray damage and are shattered. Any character in the center must save or also be stunned.
The targeted space then becomes a pit. The Warmech is immune to its own bombs.

subcontent.content: Deals bonus damage to characters in range 3.

description.content: The Warmech flies 3. When it lands, adjacent characters are shoved 1.
Foes take 2 piercing damage. Foes at exactly range 3 take 2 piercing damage twice.
All foes outside of range 3 take 2 piercing damage, ignoring cover, as an area effect.

subcontent.content: The Izenghast or an ally in range 2 teleports 1.
All foes in the area must sacrifice 4 after this ability resolves.

description.content: Each time, it deals 2 damage to an adjacent foe. Bloodied foes are dazed.
All foes in range must save or be forced to flee, shoving them 2 spaces in a direction of the Izenghast’s choice, or 1 space on a successful save.
An adjacent foe sacrifices 25% of their maximum hp. The Izenghast or another relict in range 3 is cured.

subcontent.content: The Arkitek may summon a height 1 dungeon ruin object adjacent to its target.

description.content: The Arkitek removes and places any number of objects created by it or another character in range to any other free space in range. Characters standing on or trapped inside an object are moved and placed with it.
The Arkitek summons a Pillar of Iz in range. It can be summoned under characters.

subcontent.content: All characters in range 2 are shoved 1 towards the grave, which could shove them inside of it.

description.content: Characters in range of the Grave are shoved 1 towards or away from it. The Grave can choose for each character. Bloodied characters are shoved 2 instead.
Foes take 2 damage once for each foe in the area, up to a maximum of three times.
Foes inside the Grave must save, then they take 5 damage, five times. If they succeed the save, they take 3 damage, five times instead.
Rush 2, then an adjacent foe is shoved 2 spaces.

subcontent.content: Foe is slashed. Slashed foes are stunned.

description.content: The Vessel roars, and a foe of its choice in range 6 feels the ground trembling beneath their feet.
At the end of that character’s turn, roll 1d6. The knight summons either a pit (1-3) or a height 1 dark light spire object (4-6) under that foe.
The ground erupts in a small blast area effect centered on this terrain, dealing fray damage to all characters.
The knight charges a character in range 3 with dark energy, creating a small blast area on them.
At the end of that character’s next turn, they must sacrifice 3 for every space of the cross not occupied by themselves, an ally, or a summon. Then, they gain +1 Malice.
The knight chooses a character in range.

At the end of the very next turn, if that character is still in range of the knight, it removes itself from the battlefield, then places itself adjacent to them and may make the next of its Darklight attack series against them.

subcontent.content: The knight is damaged by an ability.
The knight may teleport up to 3 spaces.

description.content: All foes in range take 2 divine damage.
Each time this ability is used again this combat, increase its damage by +1.
At the start of each round, the Lich severs part of a foe’s soul in range 4, placing it in a free space adjacent to that character.

At the end of each round, the Lich wreaks the battlefield with scathing ur-magic. All foes on the battlefield take 1 piercing damage, once, for every other foe or soul fragment that they share a row or column with on the battlefield grid map (imagine it like a big cross centered on each character).
The Lich reveals a glimpse of a possible dark future to a character in range. That character becomes vulnerable from the sheer stress and must save or become stunned.
If there are none of its allies in range 2, that character also sacrifices 25% of their maximum hp.

name: Offer Obeisance Before Thy Proper Lords

description.content: The Lich releases a word of powerful Ur-magic, ordering all foes to kneel. Foes can choose:

subcontent.content: Kneel and become immobile for the rest of the current round.
Be shoved 2 away from the Lich.

description.content: Mark a foe in range. While marked, that foe deals half damage unless adjacent to an ally.
If they end their turn adjacent to an ally, they may save to clear this mark.
The Lich either teleports 4, or removes itself from the battlefield, then places itself in free space in range 2.
Foes in the line take 2 piercing damage, then each foe deals 1 piercing damage to all its adjacent allies. Characters adjacent to more than one foe in this effect can be damaged multiple times.
Foes in the line take 2 piercing damage. The first foe in the line is shoved 2 towards the Lich, or as far as possible.

subcontent.content: Character in the center space is shattered. Then create a height 1 smoking meteor object in free space adjacent to them.
Deals bonus damage vs shattered or vulnerable foes.

description.content: At the start of the round, clear a status or mark on one of the Lords.

The Lord Evictor prepares to strike a seismic blow. At the end of the round, they slam the battlefield, affecting all characters in range 3 from them. Characters take differing effects depending on how far away they are from the Lord Evictor:

The Lord Vexator prepares to shoot a massive flurry of bolts from a greatbow at all characters close to it. At the end of the round, they release a flurry of shots, affecting all characters in range 3 from them. Characters take differing effects depending on how far away they are to the Lord Vexator:
At the start of the round, the Lord Prelictor summons three wailing souls, in free space anywhere on the battlefield not adjacent to a foe.

subcontent.content: The Lord Evictor may rush 1 before this attack.
The Lord swings their weapon in a massive arc after this ability resolves. Foes adjacent to the Lord take 2 damage again and are shoved 1.
Create a pit under the attack target.
The Lord Evictor may rush 1 before this attack.
Deals bonus damage for every difference in height etween the Lord Vexator and their target. If the difference is 2+, this ability gains unerring, foe takes 2 damage twice again and is dazed.

description.content: The Lord Evictor rushes 1, then shoves all adjacent foes 1.

subcontent.content: The other lords can also rush 1.

description.content: An adjacent foe is picked up and crushed by the Lord Evictor. Remove them from the battlefield as they are hurled into the air, then smashed down in any space in range 2, returning them.
They are slashed. Slashed characters are stunned instead.

subcontent.content: If the other one or two lords are in range 3 of the target’s landing point, they juggle the target with attacks before they land, each dealing 2 piercing damage.

description.content: The Lord Evictor smashes the ground with the hilt of their weapon, dealing fray damage to and weakening a character in range. Weakened characters are stunned.

subcontent.content: If another Lord is in range 3, the Lord Evictor can cause a shockwave that creates a height 1 debris object underneath that Lord, or raises the height of such an object by 1.

description.content: A foe at or further away than range 4 must save.
On a successful save, they are shoved 2 spaces towards the Lord Evictor. On a failed save, they are shoved until adjacent, or as far as possible.
The Lord swaps the positions of any or all of the three Lords, removing and placing them.
Summon a pit in a free space in range.
Characters that start or end their turn in the pit can be teleported by the Lord Prelictor to any other pit created by this ability or Imperishable Star.

subcontent.content: The Lord Prelictor can then teleport another Lord in range 3 2 spaces.

description.content: Foes inside take 2 piercing damage and must save or become pacified.
The Lord Prelictor marks itself or another Lord with a ward of energy. That Lord gains 10 vigor.

When this vigor is destroyed, or at the end of the round, the ward explodes, ending this mark. Foes in a large blast area effect centered on the targeted Lord take 2 piercing damage twice and must save or be shattered.
A character also loses this vigor if the mark is transferred, but it doesn’t cause the ward to explode.
The Lord Vexator leaps and flies up to 3 spaces.

subcontent.content: If they land next to another Lord, both Lords can leap and fly up to 3 spaces again, then each can deal 2 damage to an adjacent foe after landing.

description.content: The Lord Vexator gains stealth, and adjacent foes must save or become blinded.

subcontent.content: Another Lord in range 3 gains stealth.

description.content: The Lord Vexator shoots a line 6 area effect. Foes inside take fray damage.

subcontent.content: If the Lord Evictor is caught in the area, the area gains true strike, and foes in the line are then shoved 1 towards or away from the Lord Vexator.
If the Lord Prelictor is caught in the line, the arrow deals 2 piercing damage twice instead.
The Demon is targeted by attack.
The attacker can either choose to give the demon resistance to the attack OR summon two crawling masses after the attack resolves.

description.content: The demon starts to swell and grow unnaturally in size. At the start of the round, it grows its size by +1. This has no maximum.
The Demon rushes 4 spaces in a straight line with phasing. Characters in its path must save or take 2[D]+fray and be stunned, or [D]+fray damage on a successful save.
When the demon passes through a character’s space during this move, it summons a crawling mass adjacent to them, but only once per character.
A adjacent character must save or be swallowed whole. Remove them from the battlefield.
At the start of their turn, the demon spits them out, placing them in any adjacent space to the demon’s current location, then shoving them 3 spaces. They are weakened.

subcontent.content: [D] + fray and summon a crawling mass.
All foes in the area must save or be shoved 2 spaces in any direction. All crawling masses and pillars of flesh in the area also release a scream, weakening all adjacent foes.
All characters in the area in crawling mass spaces take 3 piercing damage.

description.content: The Demon agitates a crawling limbs space in range 4, transforming it into a pillar of flesh. It becomes a height 1 object, or increases its height by +1 if it is already an object.
The pillar causes engagement as if it was a character, and characters that end their turn adjacent to the pillar take 2 damage, once, per                 height of the pillar.
The demon deals 2 damage to all adjacent foes and shoves them 1.
Rush up to 3 with phasing. All characters in the demon’s space during this move are shoved 1 to either side of its movement and take 2 damage after it resolves.
Summon three blades of agony from the void anywhere on the battlefield. Characters adjacent each blade when they are summoned are shoved 1.
The demon chooses a foe in range 4 that has not acted yet, marking out the space under them.

At the end of that foe’s turn, if they are in range 4 of that space, a burning blade impales them, dealing [D]+fray damage and blinding them, then summoning a blade of agony in the chosen space. If they are further away than range 4, this effect deactivates.
A character in range is filled with boiling hatred, granting them the following effects:

subcontent.content: They take +1 damage from blades of agony.
They deal 3 damage to themselves and all adjacent foes and allies when they end their turn.

description.content: This mark ends if the marked character deals damage to the violence demon, or 2 or more allies with this mark.

subcontent.content: May dash 3, after this ability resolves.
Increase base damage by +[D], hit or miss.

description.content: A character in range from the violence demon must save or be shoved 3, or just 1 on a successful save. Then, the character is pinned down by the blade, taking piercing fray damage and becoming immobile.
They can break the blade by using the interact ability, or break free automatically at the end of their turn, ending this effect.
The violence demon marks a foe in range.

If that foe ends its turn out of range, the violence demon may teleport to any space adjacent to the marked foe, then the foe must save or become dazed and take 3 damage, three times, or just 3 damage on a successful save.
The violence demon removes itself from the battlefield, then re-appears in a space in range 3.

subcontent.content: The violence demon is targeted by an attack.
The demon gains evasion against that attack, then teleports 2.

description.content: The violence demon teleports up to 3 spaces, but must end adjacent to a foe.
The demon’s next attack gains +1 boon and deals bonus damage. This effect stacks.
A foe in range 6 is marked and impaled by three blades.

subcontent.content: At the start of their turn, a blade rips out of them, dealing 5 damage and summoning a blade of agony adjacent to them. Once this effect has triggered three times, it and the mark ends.
If the mark is removed early, summon the remaining blades in adjacent spaces to that character.

description.content: At the start of the round, the Majesty Demon makes one of the following decrees (roll 1d6).
At the start of the round, the Majesty Demon chooses two of the following decrees (roll 2d6 and discard duplicates).
A foe in range 8 must save or become weakened, slashed, dazed, blinded, vulnerable, shattered, pacified, and sealed.

On a successful save, a character is affected by two of these statuses of the demon’s choice. On a failed save, a character additionally becomes immune to a further use of this action for the rest of combat.

A foe in range 6 that has not acted yet pulses with dark energy. At the end of that character’s turn, they take 20 damage. The character can reduce this damage to 10, then deal 10 damage to an adjacent character, but only if there is an adjacent character available.

subcontent.content: Deals 2 piercing damage again to the target after this ability resolves, for each status the foe is affected by.
Foe is pacified. Pacified foes take 3 damage, three times.
Copy all statuses on the foe, then inflict them in a different foe in the area.
Character in the center space is shattered or vulnerable (demon’s choice). Then create a height 1 smoking meteor object in free space adjacent to them.

description.content: The demon chooses a foe in range. That foe is sealed and must save.
On a failed save, they are marked and become unable to attack while marked. This effect ends if the mark is transferred, or at the end of their turn.

subcontent.content: Foe is weakened or slashed (demon’s choice).

description.content: The demon spurts water, blinding or dazing a foe in range. Blinded foes take 2 damage.
All foes not in cover from the demon must save or take fray damage twice and become vulnerable, or once on a successful save. Then, summon a height 1 meteor object adjacent to any character affected.

subcontent.content: Fray damage three times on a failed save.
Fray damage five times on a failed save.
